html: Deep convulsions of Mother Earth—earthquakes, mega-volcanoes, and collisions with cosmic debris (Isaiah 5:25; 29:6; 32:19; 34:4, 9)—characterize Jehovah’s Day of Judgment. Jarred out of its current secure orbit (Isaiah 13:13), the earth reels and sways “like a drunkard,” reflecting the intoxicated spiritual state of its inhabitants. The people’s “transgressions” or “crimes” (pis‘ah ) cause them to self-destruct. The earth with its inhabitants “collapses” or “falls” (napla ) even as Greater Babylon “falls” (napla ) (Isaiah 21:9), awaiting Jehovah’s new creation out of utter chaos (Isaiah 51:16; 65:17).
